text: Newgate Prison was a jail in the city of London. It was built in 12th century and remained in use until 1902 and was demolished in 1904. Newgate was most well known for holding pirates and being a debtor's prison. Category:1900s disestablishments in the United Kingdom Category:12th-century buildings and structures Category:Prisons in England Category:Buildings and structures in the City of London
title: Newgate Prison
